page.title: 03SURVEY OF SHOPPING HABITS
page.content:
90 FAMILIES LIVING IN HAMPTON WERE ASKED TO RECORD WHERE THEY HAD DONE BASIC SHOPPING DURING THE WEEK JUNE 10 TO JUNE 16 1985. THE CHOICES WERE ANY LOCAL SHOP, SAINSBURY'S (THE NEW LOCAL SUPERMARKET) AND KINGSTON.
************************************** *{LOCAL SHOPS ONLY.................2}* *{SAINSBURY'S ONLY................13}* *{KINGSTON ONLY....................8}* *{LOCAL SHOPS AND SAINSBURY'S.....14}* *{LOCAL SHOPS AND KINGSTON.........6}* *{SAINSBURY'S AND KINGSTON........10}* *{ALL THREE.......................36}* *{NO SHOPPING THAT WEEK............1}* **************************************
IT WAS CONCLUDED FROM THE ABOVE THAT WHILE THERE WERE REASONABLE SHOPPING FACILITIES IN HAMPTON MANY FAMILIES FELT THE NEED TO GO FURTHER AFIELD.
